title: 1932 PGA Championship
text:
The 1932 PGA Championship was the 15th <a href="PGA%20Championship">PGA Championship</a>, held August 30 to September 4 at <a href="Keller%20Golf%20Course">Keller Golf Course</a> in <a href="Maplewood%2C%20Minnesota">Maplewood, Minnesota</a>, a suburb north of <a href="Saint%20Paul%2C%20Minnesota">Saint Paul</a>. Then a <a href="match%20play">match play</a> championship, <a href="Olin%20Dutra">Olin Dutra</a> won the first of his two <a href="Men%27s%20major%20golf%20championships">major</a> titles, defeating <a href="Frank%20Walsh%20%28golfer%29">Frank Walsh</a> 4 & 3. Dutra was also the medalist in the 36-hole stroke play qualifier on 
Defending champion <a href="Tom%20Creavy">Tom Creavy</a> lost in the semifinals to Walsh in 38 holes. Two-time champion <a href="Gene%20Sarazen">Gene Sarazen</a> opted to participate in sectional qualifying, but did not advance; he returned the <a href="1933%20PGA%20Championship">following year</a> and won a third 
Keller Golf Course, a municipal facility owned and operated by <a href="Ramsey%20County%2C%20Minnesota">Ramsey County</a>, hosted the PGA Championship again in <a href="1954%20PGA%20Championship">1954</a>.
Format.
The <a href="match%20play">match play</a> format at the PGA Championship in 1932 called for 12 rounds (216 holes) in six days:
